"This is a step by step guide to get started. Once the app is setup, you will mainly only " "need the last step.

"
"Notes:
" "All time offset settings are currently a textbox with this format: Hours:Minutes:Seconds.
" "All hue schedules must be configured in the standard hue app or any that is able to do this." "This app is not able to do this an just uses existing schedules!

"
"1, Setup the Sound alarm, Hue wake and sleep lights. Do this by tapping the " "settings icons (blue circles on the right) in each component respectively.
" "1a, In "Sound alarm" settings you can choose the sound to wake up to.
" "1b, In "Hue wake lights" settings you can select the hue schedules for waking up and " "a second one to switch of the lights again after some time. The offset for " "the wake up light (before wakeup) and the switch off (after wakeup) can also be set here.
" "1c, In "Hue sleep light" settings you can select the hue sleep schedule." "This has no offset, because it just starts as soon as "update" is taped (see 4.)

" "2, Activate the components you want to use with the switch buttons in the center (green circles)

" "3, Setup a relative time (from now) in which you want to wake up in the top (purple circle). " "All the offsets set up in 1x steps are relative to this time.

" "4, Press the Update button in bottom left corner (orange circle). This will calculate the " "absolute time for the Sound alarm, Hue wake and sleep lights and sets it accordingly when activated. " "You will see the new time on the left side of each component." "Make sure you are connected before pressing the button (see text below button)! " "When not connected, just press the Reconnect (bottom right) button or restart the app."
